snippet: A pregnant Indian dentist’s death revives the debate over Ireland’s almost total ban on abortions.
abstract: A pregnant Indian dentist’s death revives the debate over Ireland’s almost total ban on abortions.
lead_paragraph: The death of Savita Halappanavar, an Indian dentist living in Ireland, “who was reportedly denied a potentially lifesaving abortion even while she was having a miscarriage” has revived debate over the country’s almost total ban on abortions, Douglas Dalby wrote in The New York Times.

headline.main: Hospital Death in Ireland Renews Fight Over Abortion
